Description: Weekly seminar series covering topics of current research in applied optics, including integrated, quantum, nonlinear, and nano-optics. Current research work and literature in these areas are discussed. Enrollment by permission of instructor. (Formerly EE 280O.)
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.ECE 280Z — Seminar on Smart Grids and Da:
Course: ECE 280Z — Seminar on Smart Grids and Data Analytics
Credits: 2
Description: Weekly series covering state-of-the-art research in smart power grids, machine learning, communications, and signal processing. Current research works and recent literature are discussed. Enrollment is by permission of the instructor and is restricted to graduate students. Undergraduates may enroll by permission of the instructor. (Formerly EE 280Z.)
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.ECE 283 — Special Topics in Electrical a:
Course: ECE 283 — Special Topics in Electrical and Computer Engineering
Credits: 3
Description: Graduate seminar on a research topic in electrical engineering that varies with the particular instructor. Topics may include, but are not limited to, electromagnetics, antennas, electronics biotechnology, nanotechnology, signal processing, communications, VLSI, MEMS, and radio frequency. Enrollment is restricted to graduate students and consent of instructor. (Formerly EE 283.)
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.ECE 290 — ECE Graduate Seminar:
Course: ECE 290 — ECE Graduate Seminar
Credits: 2
Description: Leading speakers from academia and industry present their latest research.
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.ECE 291 — Tomorrow's Professors, Enginee:
Course: ECE 291 — Tomorrow's Professors, Engineers, and Entrepreneurs
Credits: 3
Description: The aim of this course is two-fold: (1) inform, motivate, and prepare graduate students for possible careers in academia and industry; (2) expose graduate students to the professional skills required for possible career options in engineering and science. Enrollment is restricted to graduate students, and by permission of the instructor. Course is for Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory grade only.
Requirements: Requirements Enrollment is restricted to graduate students.
courses.ECE 293 — Advanced Topics in Electrical:
Course: ECE 293 — Advanced Topics in Electrical and Computer Engineering
Credits: 5
Description: Graduate seminar on a research topic in electrical engineering that varies with the particular instructor. Typical topics include, but are not limited to, electromagnetics, antennas, electronics biotechnology, nanotechnology, signal processing, communications, VLSI, and MEMS. Prerequisite(s):Enrollment is by permission of the instructor and is restricted to graduate students. In some quarters course will be taught in conjunction with ECE 183 . (Formerly EE 293.)
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.ECE 296 — Master Project:
Course: ECE 296 — Master Project
Credits: 5
Description: Master project conducted under faculty supervision. Petition on file with sponsor faculty.
Requirements: No additional requirements listed.
courses.ECE 297A — Independent Study or Research:
Course: ECE 297A — Independent Study or Research
Credits: 5
Description: Independent study or research under faculty supervision. Students submit petition to sponsoring agency.
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.ECE 297B — Independent Study or Research:
Course: ECE 297B — Independent Study or Research
Credits: 10
Description: Independent study or research under faculty supervision. Students submit petition to sponsoring agency.

Course: ECE 297C — Independent Study or Research
Credits: 15
Description: Independent study or research under faculty supervision. Students submit petition to sponsoring agency.
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.ECE 297F — Independent Study or Research:
Course: ECE 297F — Independent Study or Research
Credits: 2
Description: Independent study or research under faculty supervision. Students submit petition to sponsoring agency.
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.ECE 299A — Thesis Research:
Course: ECE 299A — Thesis Research
Credits: 5
Description: Thesis research conducted under faculty supervision. Students submit petition to sponsoring agency.
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
courses.ECE 299B — Thesis Research:
Course: ECE 299B — Thesis Research
Credits: 10
Description: Thesis research conducted under faculty supervision. Students submit petition to sponsoring agency.

courses.ECE 299C — Thesis Research:
Course: ECE 299C — Thesis Research

courses.CRSN 81C — Designing a Sustainable Futur:
Course: CRSN 81C — Designing a Sustainable Future
Credits: 5
Description: Introduces key technological solutions to environmental problems; discusses their underlying principles; and examines their societal dimensions. Topics include: conventional and renewable energy; emerging technologies for transportation, energy efficiency clean water; planetary engineering; and lean manufacturing.
Requirements: Requirements Enrollment is restricted to first-year and sophomore college members.
